title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 November 2015 - XWiki

11:46 <vmassol> good it seems we're ok on CI to release 7.4M1  
13:09 <Ramona1> has quit  
13:10 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <MasterPiece> has quit  
16:01 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has joined #xwiki  
16:02 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Hi, I'm trying to use the Document tree gadget on xwiki... the thing is it shows my document tree fine only when i'm in editing mode  
16:19 <ClemensR> what does it do in view mode then? any error messages ? JS errors in the console, etc?  
16:19 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has quit  
16:20 <ClemensR> Another random other question: does anyone knows what removes old revisions on l10n.xwiki.org ?  
16:20 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has joined #xwiki  
16:20 <ClemensR> Some users would like to have something similar for their xwiki ...  
16:21 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> There's no error, in view mode it's just blank..  
16:22 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> This is on xwiki 7.1.1 btw  
16:22 <ClemensR> and it is on the dashboard ?  
16:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> yes  
16:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> though in view mode, it only shows the gadget title with its content blank  
16:24 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> then I go into edit mode and I see the contents as I would expect them...  
16:25 \* ClemensR waits for its ol' little 7.1.1. to start up  
16:27 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Dunno if it's worth upgrading to 7.3  
16:27 <ClemensR> narf, works for me out of the box ...  
16:28 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Hmm...  
16:28 <ClemensR> if you open the browsers network tab, can you see requests for something like /xwiki/bin/get/XWiki/DocumentTree been send ?  
16:30 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> What do you mean?  
16:35 <ClemensR> normally the document tree is loaded in a separate request - wich should show up ias network traffic (Ctrl-Shift Q for Fireforx, F11 for IE (I think), Ctrl-Shift I  for google chrome)  
16:36 <ClemensR> if it is shown, the problem is wit displaying the data. if there is no network traffic, it is a problem initializing the tree  
16:38 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Hmm interesting  
16:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> I am on firefox, checked network, I don't see anything mentioning document tree portion  
16:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> I've also tried to use a different gadget/extension: dynamic tree hierarchy  
16:39 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> but it can only support a single space?  
16:40 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Hmm so I just noticed an issue.  
16:40 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> GET tree-finder.js returned 404  
16:41 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> is that related to that document tree at all?  
16:41 <ClemensR> ah, ok  
16:42 <ClemensR> that gives a clue: the code initializing the tree is not found  
16:42 <ClemensR> do you use any URL-shortening. like avoding the '/view/' part in the URL  
16:42 <ClemensR> ?  
16:44 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> no, the view part is in the url  
16:45 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> http://wiki.~~~~.ca/xwiki/wiki/hwhome/view/WikiManager/tree-finder.js  
16:47 <Enygma`> has quit  
16:53 <ClemensR> hm, tree-finder.js is not what the document tree uses, but jstree.min.js  
16:54 <ClemensR> but I have not tried to reproduce in a subwiki  
16:54 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> it says it got jstree.min.js from http://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/jstree/3.0.8/jstree.min.js  
16:55 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:58 <msmeria> has quit  
16:59 <ClemensR> and   .../jsx/Macros/Tree?language=en   is loaded, too ?  
17:00 <ClemensR> (also needs some /xwiki-platform-tree-webjar/ ... but well, you said it works in edit view, so this must be there ... )  
17:00 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> yes  
17:00 <ClemensR> how does  ../hwhome/view/XWiki/DocumentTree  look like ?  
17:01 <ClemensR> should contains lots of tree samples  
17:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Can't find that one  
17:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> hmm  
17:03 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> ../xwiki-platform-tree-webjar/ is ok I believe but can't find the documentTree one  
17:04 <vmassol> mflorea and others: interesting read: https://cksource.com/blog/CKEditor-5-The-Future-of-Rich-Text-Editing  
17:04 <vmassol> (points to https://medium.com/content-uneditable/ckeditor-5-the-future-of-rich-text-editing-2b9300f9df2c )  
17:07 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Hmm  
17:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> So while in edit mode I got .../hwhome/get/XWiki/DocumentTree?outputSyntax=plain&showSpaces=true&data=children&id=#  
17:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> and that was fine  
17:08 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> went to the log and said this: Failed to execute the [velocity] macro. Click on this message for details.org.xwiki.rendering.macro.MacroExecutionException: Failed to evaluate Velocity Macro for content [#if ($xcontext.action == 'get')   #updateDocTreeConfigFromRequest   #handleDocumentTreeRequest #end]  
17:09 <tmortagne> ClemensR: "what removes old revisions on l10n.xwiki.org" what do you mean ?  
17:10 <ClemensR> usually if one changes an existing translation this creates a new version of the page  
17:10 <ClemensR> and if checkign back after some weeks, the old version is gone  
17:11 <tmortagne> you sure about the "some weeks" ?  
17:11 <tmortagne> we did lost all history some time in the past because of an admin trying to do "optimization" but that  was a long time ago  
17:11 <ClemensR> e.g.: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/PlatformXWikiCoreResources\_-1968975802\_export\_backuppack\_de?viewer=history  
17:12 <ClemensR> edited some time ago, now only contains a version 7.1  
17:12 <ClemensR> I think it has a version 6.1 two weeks ago when I changed it  
17:13 <tmortagne> you sure it was this one ?  
17:13 <tmortagne> see http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/PlatformPanelsCodeTranslations\_-1686944277\_platform-panels-applications-revert\_fr#History for example  
17:13 <tmortagne> http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/PlatformXWikiCoreResources\_-1968975802\_export\_backuppack\_de?viewer=history is a pretty old key and its history was probably lost in the event I indicated  
17:13 <ClemensR> but it is just a question out of curiosity ... I thought something does it intentionally  
17:14 <tmortagne> no there is no scheduler about removing history and we really don't want to remove history anyway because we do stats on it  
17:15 <ClemensR> not sure about it, just wondering if there is something "cleaning up" intentionally, because some users asked be of a feature like this. Seems I misunderstood an accident an a feature ;)  
17:16 <tmortagne> maybe there is something on extensions.xwiki.org  
17:16 <tmortagne> like in the admin tool  
17:16 <tmortagne> "Remove old history to make room" or something like this  
17:17 <ClemensR> xwikiorg\_guest\_1: ok, if DocumenTree is not found in the subwiki, and only available on the main wiki, then it is somewhat a "bug" that it uses the document tree in edit view form the main wiki  
17:18 <ClemensR> tmortagne: there are the admin tools for the recycle bin, but they only work on mysql; nothing found to delete old versions, the closest is   http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Display+documents+having+several+versions  (which is a starting point in any case)  
17:19 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> So to recap: In edit mode, I see the /XWiki/DocumentTree in my Network on firefox, but in normal mode I don't, and tree-finder.js gets error 404  
17:19 <ClemensR> xwikiorg\_guest\_1:  maybe you can try to export the page  XWiki.DocumentTree from the main wiki and import it into the subwiki?  
17:19 <ClemensR> and see if that fixes things?  
17:19 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> How would one go about doing that?  
17:20 <ClemensR> go to the XWiki/DocumentTree in the main wiki (assuming you are admin there) and Use "Export" -> "Export as XAR"  
17:20 <ClemensR> then use the "Import" section of the wiki administration in the subwiki to import the page  
17:21 <ClemensR> tmortagne: agh, I see you meant: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Remove+Document+History  thanks! did use the wrong keywords for search :)  
17:22 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Sorry ClemensR, i'm having a bit of trouble following  
17:22 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> Is XWiki/DocumentTree the gadget?  
17:22 <ClemensR> are you Admin in the main wiki, too?  
17:23 <ClemensR> it is a wiki page  
17:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> All I've done was go into our subwiki, edit, create new gadget and use documentTree  
17:23 <ClemensR> in space "XWiki", page name "DocumentTree:  
17:23 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> I've logged in as admin yes

18:44 <vmassol> 2015-11-26 18:44:21,000 [Thread-1] WARN  o.i.j.ResourceDMBean           - ISPN000042: Did not find queried attribute with name coreHashCode  
18:45 <vmassol> I think I remember that you fixed it in earlier version, no?  
18:45 <mflorea> no  
18:45 <mflorea> it's an open issue, requires Solr upgrade  
18:46 <vmassol> k I must have mixed with something else then
